articles.title: DPRK Will Actively Join in Int'l Efforts to Protect Global Environment: FM Ri Su Yong
articles.content:
DPRK Will Actively Join in Int'l Efforts to Protect Global Environment: FM Ri Su Yong
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong, head of the DPRK delegation, made a speech at the high-ranking officials' meeting of the UN Climate Change Conference held in Paris, France on December 7. 
					 He said that the climate change is not an issue confined to a certain country, but an urgent task to be tackled by the international community as it is a crucial matter affecting the coming generations and the future of humankind. 
					
					 He appreciated that measures to take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts were reflected as one of the post-2015 SDGs adopted at the UN Summit in last September. 
					
					 He also welcomed the Paris Agreement as a result of series of negotiations.
					
					 He stressed that the following should be attained in due process of achieving the goals of the agreement.
					
					 First, it is of great importance for all the countries to correctly understand the global character of the climate change issue and pay primary attention to ensuring international unity in the efforts to addressing this issue. 
					
					 Second, it is necessary to foster international and regional cooperation in climate change mitigation, in particular, focusing on the provision of financial and technical assistance for the developing countries at an earliest date possible. 
					
					 Third, any egoistic and unfair preconditions should not be brought up while providing assistance through funds such as the Green Climate Fund and it is important to reject the politicization and comply with the principle of fairness in the implementation of international mechanisms such as the CDM. 
					
					 The DPRK government will continue to faithfully discharge its responsibilities as a party to the UNFCCC and actively engage itself in the international efforts to protect the global environment, he concluded.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Angolan Party
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Angolan Party
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to the Central Committee of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola (PLMA) on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of its foundation.
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the WPK and the PLMA would grow stronger in the interests of the peoples of the DPRK and Angola in the future, too, the message sincerely wished the PLMA greater success in the work for its development and the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: State Merited Chorus and Moranbong Band Leave for China
articles.content:
State Merited Chorus and Moranbong Band Leave for China
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Merited Chorus and Moranbong Band left here Wednesday to pay a friendship visit to China. 
					 They are led by Choe Hwi, first vice-department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: State Merited Chorus, Pride of Songun Korea
articles.content:
State Merited Chorus, Pride of Songun Korea
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The State Merited Chorus and the Moranbong Band of the DPRK will soon pay a friendship visit to China.
					 The State Merited Chorus, which emerged an elite chorus under the care of leader Kim Jong Il endowed with musical talents who regarded music as his life companion, is a pride of Songun Korea that has registered only victory and glory for many years along with songs of revolution.
					
					 The Chorus is noted for its rich volume of voice and flawless ensemble and all its members' musical talents are beyond imagination.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK love the Chorus as a revolutionary group of singers imbuing the whole world with the soul of Paektu as it is full of vigor and optimism of the revolutionary army and it reflects the revolutionary spirit of Juche in each song.
					
					 Through its performances the Chorus has inspired the servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK to wage a vigorous struggle for the defence of the socialist country and the building of an economic giant.
					
					 The powerful songs sung by the State Merited Chorus are just a vivid representation of the idea and faith of Songun Korea holding high the red flag.
					
					 Encouraged by such vigorous and militant songs infusing confidence in victory and the spirit of defending the red flag, all the Korean people are making a drive to build a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The songs by the Chorus represent the DPRK people's strong will to devotedly defend socialism, put an end to imperialism and bring the rosy future of thriving Korea.
					
					 That's why the conductor of a noted foreign chorus said that the songs of the DPRK State Merited Chorus would help unify the world with the red flag. "Once, Westerners said that our chorus' performance occupied them without firing a single shot. Now, I am sure that the songs of the DPRK chorus can purify the whole world without firing a bullet," he added.
					
					 The voice of justice and the song of victory by the State Merited Chorus, a veteran art troupe of the DPRK, will resound in China, further promoting the development of traditional relations of friendship between the two peoples as its visit to Russia evoked a lively response.

articles.title: Moranbong Band of DPRK
articles.content:
Moranbong Band of DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Moranbong Band, which is popular among the Korean people as a model of the Juche-based literature and art and a worldwide stylish band, will soon give friendship performances in China, together with the State Merited Chorus.
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un organized a new light music band in Juche 101(2012) as a successor to the Pochonbo Electronic Ensemble, established by leader Kim Jong Il, and named it Moranbong he liked.
					
					 In July three years ago, Kim Jong Un watched a demonstration performance of the Moranbong Band and appreciated it for having greatly improved all the musical elements--from theme and formation to arrangement, composition of instruments, technical skill and representation.
					
					 Since its birth the Band has creditably played its role as the first standard-bearer on the ideological and cultural front, arousing all the service personnel and people to the building of a thriving nation through its fresh and go-ahead performance activities full of the stamina of the era of Songun (military-first).
					
					 It opened up a new path in art creation with the spirit of devotedly carrying out the tasks given by the Party and with the innovative view and great enthusiasm for creation and through the collectivist emulation.
					
					 Through its many successful performances the band has won a great popularity among the audience.
					
					 Its history is short but it enjoys love of all the people for its high skills and for its fresh and vivacious performances. Each song put on the stage by the band has become a companion of citizens in their cultural life.
					
					 It is a high pride of the Korean people to have the band fully demonstrating its honor as an art troupe under the direct guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea and an art organization of national treasure.
					
					 The Band will as ever inspiringly encourage the servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK to building a thriving nation by creditably discharging its mission as the first guard of Songun artistes who stand in the van of upholding the music politics of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Remodeled Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace Inaugurated
articles.content:
Remodeled Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace Inaugurated
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The splendidly remodeled Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace was inaugurated with due ceremony on Tuesday.
					 The palace has turned into a modern comprehensive extracurricular education center for school youth and children and a pedigree establishment for training talents. It has best conditions for education and accommodation including science and art buildings, theater, gymnasium, swimming pool and dormitory.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok and Ro Tu Chol, Ri Il Hwan, department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Su Gil, chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, schoolchildren in the city and members of the Korean schoolchildren's art troupe in Japan. 
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, made an inaugural speech.
					
					 He said that the palace has been remodeled thanks to the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un who is translating into reality the noble outlook of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on the rising generation.
					
					 He recalled that Kim Jong Un unrolled a plan to remodel the palace, which was built under the loving care of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, as required by the new century and energetically led the whole course of remodeling project.
					
					 It is the steadfast will and determination of our party to bring up the younger generation to be reliable successors to the Juche revolutionary cause and achieve the eternal prosperity of Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea.
					
					 Rosy future is always in store for the thriving DPRK when its service personnel and people remain loyal to Kim Jong Un who dedicates himself to the rising generation, saying that when they hear the cheerful laughter of the children, the whole country looks happy. 
					
					 The speaker called for waging a dynamic drive for realizing the beautiful dream and ideal of the people and carving out the bright future of the great Paektusan nation, rallied close around Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Army and social officials let the inaugural tape stretch and schoolchildren cut off the tape.
					
					  At the end of the ceremony, the participants looked round various places of the palace.

articles.title: Guiding Force of Korean Revolution
articles.content:
Guiding Force of Korean Revolution
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The victorious advance of the DPRK and glorious path covered by it have been embroidered with the immortal exploits performed by the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The WPK is the party imbued with revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the guiding force of the Korean revolution leading the country, the revolution and the people to victory.
					
					 The WPK has advanced lines and policies, strategy and tactics on the basis of the revolutionary idea of its leaders, achieved sing-hearted unity of all the people around the leader and made all its efforts to materialize the wishes of the people.
					
					 Thanks to its wise leadership, the DPRK could win great victories in the Fatherland Liberation War, post-war reconstruction, two stages of social revolution and socialist construction.
					
					 In the new century, the WPK set forth the line of simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force and the idea of building a socialist economic giant and civilized nation.
					
					 All its idea and policies have served as the firm guiding principle reflecting the faith of all the servicepersons and people to unfailingly build a thriving socialist nation true to the behests of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Now, the army and people of the DPRK are fully determined to greet the 7th Congress of the WPK with high political enthusiasm and unprecedented labor achievement.

articles.title: Successes Made in Research on Greenhouse Farming
articles.content:
Successes Made in Research on Greenhouse Farming
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute under the Academy of Agricultural Science in the DPRK has made successes in the research on greenhouse vegetable growing.
					 The institute invented a new method of cabbage cultivation, thus laying scientific and technical bases for growing it all the year round.
					
					 Researchers of the institute found methods of cultivating high-yielding green tomato with strong resistance to pathogen and a new variety of greenhouse pepper.
					
					 Meanwhile, the institute developed a program diagnosing nutrition of vegetables and introduced a new technology of keeping nourishments around roots to produce hundreds of tons of vegetable per hectare in hydroponic greenhouse.

articles.title: Spiral Cerebral CT Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Spiral Cerebral CT Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Teachers and researchers of the study group of Kim Chaek University of Technology developed in Korean style a spiral cerebral CT machine, the most advanced computer-aided tomographic device.
					 The machine is capable of detecting with accuracy all kinds of brain-related diseases such as cerebral hemorrhage, cerebral thrombosis and cerebral tumor. This will greatly contribute to the promotion of people's health.  
					
					 The success made by them will be widely used in different fields of the national economy.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Pushing Ahead with Great Advance in Spirit of Self-Reliance
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Pushing Ahead with Great Advance in Spirit of Self-Reliance 
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Self-reliance means the revolutionary spirit and the fighting principle peculiar to the Korean people and the path of building a thriving nation, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an editorial.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The long history of the Korean revolution and the DPRK's history of building a rich and powerful country are the history of self-reliance.
					
					 Our party and people brought about shining victories in the arduous anti-imperialist revolutionary war and rehabilitation and construction, the serious socialist revolution of the two stages and the socialist construction of various stages by turning the Juche idea into tremendous might for struggle and changes. In these periods the Korean people suffered unprecedented hardships and trials but they could enjoy all sorts of honor without precedent in the history of the nation spanning thousands of years. This was possible because they remained true to the principle of self-reliance.
					
					 Self-reliance represents the fighting stamina of true revolutionaries who always cover one road under the leadership of our party and the fighting mode of those strong in faith as they are firmly convinced of inexhaustible power of truth proved by the Juche idea.
					
					 Although there are manifold difficulties and trials in the way of the revolution, we should travel only one road of Juche, the path of self-reliance to victory and prosperity. 
					
					 "Let's give fuller play to the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance created in the forest of Mt. Paektu!" This is the militant banner to be invariably held fast to and required by the era and the revolution.
					
					 The editorial calls on all service personnel and people to more dynamically advance along the road of Juche, the path of self-reliance under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un and greet the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea as the great heyday of the revolution.

articles.title: People's Rights Can Be Achieved Only through Resolute Struggle and Indomitable Efforts: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
People's Rights Can Be Achieved Only through Resolute Struggle and Indomitable Efforts: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Human rights issues are now being handled in the world political arena frequently as the most sensitive and important matters, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an editorial article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 What matters is that disputes and social confusion and human rights abuses fester in major strategic areas and hot spots whenever a specified country styling itself a "human rights champion" and "human rights judge" becomes increasingly assertive. 
					
					 The human rights issue is the one of protecting and ensuring human rights.
					
					 Human rights can be guaranteed only when sovereignty is protected. 
					
					 Everybody lives and develops as a member of the country and the nation. Human rights are to be guaranteed with a country and nation as a unit.
					
					 The international treaty related to human rights is to be implemented and the activities of international organizations are to be conducted in reliance on each country's policy and social system, to be specific. That is why, the present international laws and regulations on human rights set common standard and objectives of human rights which each country should achieve on the premise of respecting the sovereignty.
					
					 This means that each country should guarantee and ensure the rights of popular masses in conformity with its actual conditions and its level of development.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the imperialists are justifying their interference in the internal affairs of other countries under the pretext that "there is no border in human rights".
					
					 Gone are the days when the imperialists could change the border of other country as they pleased with artillery pieces and warships. And so they are working hard to attain their purpose of aggression by picking up "human rights issues".
					
					 The spread of U.S.-style view on value and "human rights standard" is nothing but a dangerous act of abusing human rights of the whole humankind.
					
					 The "human rights" racket of the U.S., the empire of misanthropy, human rights abuses and illegal acts which remains utterly indifferent to the popular masses and sovereign state and defies international law, is bound to go bust owing to its reactionary nature, vulgarity and ugly nature. It will serve as catalyzer precipitating the end of the "world's only superpower".
					
					 As long as there exist unpopular forces violating human rights of masses on the earth, they can never be achieved by talking or asking for help. The people's aspiration and desire can be achieved only through a resolute struggle and indomitable efforts.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Give up Double-Dealing Tactics
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Give up Double-Dealing Tactics
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are letting loose a litany of rhetoric that it is too early to say about "sincere approach of the north" towards the north-south authorities talks and it is necessary to "wait and see" and its attitude is "skeptical." 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 What the south Korean authorities uttered in the run-up to the talks is very improper behavior bereft of elementary etiquette toward the dialogue partner and obstructive to the talks. 
					
					 There should be a climate for dialogue between the north and the south and improvement of their relations, to begin with. Talking about dialogue only would not help create a climate. Practical action should be taken before talking. The climate for the improvement of the north-south relations means one for national reconciliation and unity and reunification of the country. 
					
					 The north-south relations have not improved despite of the north's good will, generosity and disinterested efforts mainly because of the double-dealing tactics of the south Korean authorities who are getting frantic with the confrontation racket against the compatriots in the north, while paying lip-service to "dialogue." 
					
					 The south Korean authorities are chiefly to blame for chilling the atmosphere of dialogue as they are desperately kicking up confrontation rackets in disregard of the agreement on the improvement of the inter-Korean relations reached between the north and the south. 
					
					 In order to build confidence between the north and the south and defuse confrontation the south Korean authorities should give up collusion and nexus with outside forces aimed to stifle the compatriots in the north, among other things. 
					
					 They should show their sincerity towards dialogue and improved inter-Korean relations, though belatedly.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Ambition for Overseas Expansion Denounced
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Ambition for Overseas Expansion Denounced
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Days ago, the Japanese defense minister expressed the will to introduce THAAD developed by the U.S., talking about "missile threat from the DPRK." It means defending Japan from "missile strike" of the DPRK by introducing THAAD. 
					 Minju Joson Wednesday in a commentary discloses the sinister aim sought by the Japanese reactionaries in the introduction of THAAD. 
					
					 Japan's introduction of THAAD is a link in its chain efforts to implement its strategy to become a military giant, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 Now that Japan has turned into a country capable of fighting a war through the adoption of the security law, Japan is busy with the production and development of latest weaponry. 
					
					 It is the intention of the Japanese reactionaries to massively produce latest weapons to let the "Self-Defense Forces" rank itself among the world's military giants and maximize capability for war operations. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' expression of the will to introduce THAAD is a revelation of the wild ambition to hold military supremacy in Asia by bolstering up Japan's military muscle. 
					
					 So to speak, Japan seeks to secure an edge in the area of strategic offensive forces to contain China and create favorable conditions for emerging a "leader of Asia". 
					
					 If Japan deploys THAAD in the country, it will surely become the primary target of the other belligerent party, the commentary warns.
					
					 It urged the Japanese reactionaries to stop such foolish act of inviting disaster, if they want to escape the tragedy of bringing the whole of Japan under water.

articles.title: Members of Former Unified Progressive Party Sentenced to Prison Terms in S. Korea
articles.content:
Members of Former Unified Progressive Party Sentenced to Prison Terms in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The fascist south Korean authorities sentenced the members of the former Unified Progressive Party (UPP) to prison terms on charges of attempted rebellion, according to the south Korean online paper Newsis on Dec. 4. 
					 Suwon District Court on Dec. 3 respectively sentenced the spokesperson and chairpersons of Koyang and Phaju regions of the former UPP to two and half years' imprisonment and two and half years' suspension of qualification and the chairman of the youth of the former UPP to three years' imprisonment and three years' suspension of qualification.
					
					 The court took such a fascist action upon them on charges of violation of the "Security Law", holding that they admired and expressed sympathy with the north at a secret meeting presided over by Ri Sok Gi, lawmaker from the former UPP, and they had enemy-benefiting publications.
					
					 It has been confirmed by the decision of the Supreme Court in south Korea that there is no "underground revolutionary organization" and suspicion of attempted rebellion.
					
					 This notwithstanding, the Intelligence Service and other conservative forces kicked up a investigation ruckus and sentenced them to prison terms on charges of "following the north" in a bid to justify the illegality of forcibly dissolving the progressive party and the confrontation policy against the compatriots in the north.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Support Struggle of S. Koreans
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Support Struggle of S. Koreans
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy in the U.S. held a meeting in Los Angeles on Dec. 3 to mark the first anniversary of its formation. 
					 Its Chairman Kim Si Hwan said that the number of prisoners of conscience is on the rapid increase under the present south Korean regime. 
					
					 He appealed to the Koreans in the U.S. to take an active part in the work for supporting prisoners of conscience. 
					
					 Paek Sung Bae, chairman of the U.S. Regional Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification, Yun Kil Sang, chairman of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S., and others made speeches. 
					
					 They said that a lot of south Korean workers and peasants launched actions against the ruling quarters driving people's living to destitution, adding that they would positively support the south Koreans' actions.
					
					 A report on the activities of the organization was made to be followed by the reading out of a statement.

articles.title: Meeting for Realizing UN Human Rights Recommendations Held in Japan
articles.content:
Meeting for Realizing UN Human Rights Recommendations Held in Japan
 Tokyo, December 8 (KNS-KCNA) -- A meeting for realizing the UN human rights recommendations took place in Tokyo, Japan on Dec. 5.
					 Present there were the teaching staff and students of Korean University and other Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Also present there were personages of civic organizations of Japan such as the Liaison Council against the Exclusion of Korean Schools from the Application of the Tuition-waiver Program for Senior High Schools and the Liaison Council for the Law on Human Rights of Foreigners, lawyers and teachers of universities.
					
					 The speakers said that the Japanese government is turning its back on the UN recommendations related to human rights such as the issue of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and the issue of exclusion of Korean schools from the application of tuition-waiver program for senior high school.
					
					 It has no qualifications to talk about human rights and democracy, to say nothing of the permanent membership of the UNSC as it denies UN recommendations on human rights, they noted, urging Japan to fulfill its duty for improving human rights.
					
					 They called for joining the solidarity movement for improving human rights and achieving peace against the crackdown on human rights, freedom and peace.

articles.title: Japan-Korea Cultural Interchange Meeting Held in Japan
articles.content:
Japan-Korea Cultural Interchange Meeting Held in Japan
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Japan-Korea cultural interchange meeting was held in Tokyo on Dec. 2.
					 Present there were Tokuji Yanagisawa, deputy chief director of the Japan-Korea Cultural Interchange Association, Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, and people from all walks of life of Japan.
					
					 Invited there were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, and officials of Chongryon.
					
					 Tukuji Yanagisawa in his speech referred to the fact that during the past 43 years since the formation of the association, colorful cultural interchange events were briskly conducted even in the absence of diplomatic relations between Japan and the DPRK. 
					
					 He stressed the need to promote friendship between Japan and the DPRK and conduct dynamic interchange work to put the relations between the two countries on a normal basis.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed in Myanmar, Nigeria
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed in Myanmar, Nigeria
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- There took place remembrance events in Myanmar and Nigeria on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's demise.
					 The Yangon Regional Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar held a remembrance meeting, photo exhibition and film show, the Ministry of Rural Development of Zamfara State in Nigeria a book exhibition and a center in Nigeria a week of DPRK film show between Nov. 27 and Dec. 3.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos dealing with the life and exploits of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 There were also books and photos introducing the achievements made by the army and people of the DRPK for building a thriving nation.
					
					 Tin Tin Moe, member of the Central Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, said that Kim Jong Il, creditable successor to President Kim Il Sung's idea and cause, developed in depth the Juche idea, put the DPRK's national power on the highest level and developed the Korean People's Army into a matchless army.
					
					 Kim Jong Il passed away on a running train while making tireless journey for field guidance for building a thriving nation and people's happiness till the last moments of his life, he noted, adding:
					
					 Though he passed away, his revolutionary cause of Songun is being creditably carried forward without an inch of deflection.
					
					 At the events held in Nigeria speakers said that Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into an independent power and brought about a radical turn in the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Foreign Figures
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- There took place seminars on leader Kim Jong Il's exploits in Romania and Indonesia on Dec. 1 and 3 on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Romanian committee for remembering Kim Jong Il, said in his speech that Kim Jong Il was the great leader of the Korean people who creditably carried forward the idea and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and performed feats for the Korean revolution and the world socialist cause, adding:
					
					 He put forward the original line of the Songun revolution and directed great efforts to bolstering national defense capabilities and thus developed the Korean People's Army into an invincible army.
					
					 The Korean people have advanced along the road of socialism despite the imperialists' vicious moves to stifle it thanks to the outstanding and tested leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, will always be remembered by the world progressives.
					
					 Harn Sinuraya, manager of the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co. of Indonesia, said that Kim Jong Il was the people's leader who dedicated all his life to the people's happiness till the last moments of his life.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian Media
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The august name and exploits of leader Kim Jong Il will shine forever along with holy Mt. Paektu.
					 The Eastern Siberian Publishing House situated in Irkutsk Region of Russia on November 23 posted an article on its homepage under the title of "Mt. Paektu and Kim Jong Il".
					
					 The homepage illustrated with the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was born in Mt. Paektu, a base for the anti-Japanese armed struggle, on February 16, 1942.
					
					 He wrote a poem "O Korea, I Will Add Glory to Thee" when he entered Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 It reflected his noble will to lead Korea to a bright future, being responsible for it, true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Kim Jong Il glorified Korea as an invincible socialist power, guided by his faith and will.
					
					 When the President passed away at a time when socialism collapsed in different countries and the imperialist allied forces intensified their anti-socialist offensive against the DPRK in the closing years of the last century, the international community talked about the policy switchover in it.
					
					 At that time Kim Jong Il solemnly declared that no one should expect any change from him and enforced the Songun politics in all fields.
					
					 He smashed the imperialists' every anti-DPRK provocative campaign and firmly defended the sovereignty of the country and the nation.
					
					 He ushered in the June 15 era of reunification, carving out a bright future of national reunification.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed in Benin
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed in Benin
 Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was the great leader of the Korean people who performed great feats guaranteeing the solid foundation and promising a rosy future of socialist Korea.
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and director of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader", said this in a statement issued on Dec. 3 on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's demise.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il endowed with extraordinary ideo-theoretical wisdom conducted energetic activities, formulating the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung as the integral system of idea, theory and method of Juche.
					
					 He developed the Workers' Party Korea into an ever-victorious guiding force and consolidated the DPRK to be an invincible socialist state and turned the Korean People's Army into a matchless army.
					
					 The immortal exploits he made by dedicating all his life will always remain the most precious heritages guaranteeing the accomplishment of the socialist cause in the DPRK and human cause of independence.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong se refiere a esfuerzo de RPDC para proteger el ambiente terrestre
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong se refiere a esfuerzo de RPDC para proteger el ambiente terrestre
Pyongyang, 9 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El canciller Ri Su Yong, jefe de delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, pronuncio el dia 7 un discurso en la reunion de funcionarios de alto rango de la Conferencia de Cambio Climatico de la ONU, efectuada en Paris de Francia.
					Ri senalo que en la actualidad el cambio climatico no es el problema limitado a un pais, sino es el problema vital relacionado con el destino de los miembros de las generaciones actuales y venideras y del futuro de la humanidad, y se presenta como tarea apremiante para la comunidad internacional.
					
					Y aprecio que la medida de accion urgente por la lucha contra el cambio climatico y su influencia fue reflexionada como articulo individual en la "agenda de desarrollo posterior al ano 2015", adoptada en el pasado septiembre en la ONU.
					
					Dando bienvenida al proyecto del convenio de Paris de caracter universal para el control de gas invernadero, aprobado al cabo de las repetidas negociaciones, el canciller coreano subrayo:
					
					Primero, todos los paises deberan comprender correctamente el caracter global del problema del cambio climatico y, basandose en esto, prestar la atencion primordial a asegurar la unidad internacional en los esfuerzos para enfrentar con ello.
					
					Segundo, hay que fortalecer la cooperacion internacional y regional en el enfrentamiento con el cambio climatico y, sobre todo, prestar atencion para que se ofrezcan a tiempo las asistencias financieras y tecnicas sobre los paises en vias de desarrollo.
					
					Tercero, no tienen que presentar las precondiciones egoistas e injustas en la cooperacion mediante el Fondo de Clima Verde y otros, rechazar la politizacion y observar el principio de imparcialidad en la ejecucion de los mecanismos internacionales como el sistema de desarrollo limpio.
					
					El canciller Ri apunto que, en lo adelante tambien, el gobierno de la RPDC ejecutara con sinceridad el deber del pais firmante del acuerdo de cambio climatico de la ONU y se sumara activamente a los esfuerzos internacionales para la proteccion del ambiente global.

articles.title: Parten de Pyongyang hacia China Coro Estatal Benemerito y Banda Moranbong
articles.content:
Parten de Pyongyang hacia China Coro Estatal Benemerito y Banda Moranbong
 Pyongyang, 9 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Coro Estatal Benemerito y la Banda Moranbong de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea presididos por Choe Hui, primer subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea partieron el dia 9 de esta capital para realizar una funcion-visita de amistad a la Republica Popular China.

articles.title: Inaugurado Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Inaugurado Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, 9 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 8 una ceremonia inaugural del Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae.
					El palacio convertido mas modernamente como base integral de educacion extraescolar para los escolares y ninos y centro supremo de la educacion de los talentos, esta dispuesto en el nivel maximo de las condiciones y ambientes necesarios a la ensenanza y vida, tales como el edificio de ciencia, el de arte, el teatro, el gimnasio, la piscina y la residencia.
					
					Tomaron parte en el acto Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Ro Tu Chol, Ri Il Hwan, jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Su Gil, secretario jefe del Comite del PTC en la ciudad de Pyongyang, los escolares y ninos en esta capital, asi como los integrantes del grupo artistico de los ninos escolares coreanos residentes en Japon.
					
					La palabra de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Jon Yong Nam, presidente del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung.
					
					El orador senalo que el palacio es el producto precioso levantado gracias a la direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un quien lleva a feliz termino la noble concepcion de las generaciones venideras de los grandes lideres, y prosiguio:
					
					El Mariscal presento el proyecto de reconstruir de acuerdo con la demanda del nuevo siglo el palacio construido bajo el amor del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y dirigio energicamente todo el proceso de la obra.
					
					El PTC mantiene la invariable voluntad y decision de lograr la eterna prosperidad de la Corea de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il al formar a las nuevas generaciones como fidedignas continuadoras de la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					Esta el futuro eterno de la Corea prospera al seguir la noble concepcion de las generaciones venideras del Mariscal quien dedica todo lo suyo para las nuevas generaciones.
					
					Exhorto a todos unirse mas compactamente en torno al Mariscal y empenarse mas vigorosamente por realizar el sueno e ideal hermosos del pueblo y el radiante porvenir de la potencia del monte Paektu.
					
					Los funcionarios del ejercito y las entidades civiles tendieron la cinta de inauguracion y los ninos escolares la cortaron. 
					
					Terminado el acto, los participantes recorrieron varios lugares del palacio.

articles.title: Se puede lograr DD.HH. con tenaz lucha e indoblegables esfuerzos, apunta Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Se puede lograr DD.HH. con tenaz lucha e indoblegables esfuerzos, apunta Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 9 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En un articulo de la Redaccion de este miercoles, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que en la actualidad el tema de los derechos humanos se trata como agenda mas delicada e importante en la palestra politica mundial. 
					Lo problematico es que cada vez que se presenta la insistencia de un pais especifico autodenominado como "defensor de DD.HH." y "juez de DD.HH." se agravan los conflictos y el caos social en los principales puntos estrategicos y zonas candentes y se tornan mas severos los crimenes de violacion de DD.HH.. 
					
					El problema de DD.HH. significa el asunto de proteger y asegurar los derechos humanos. 
					
					Los derechos humanos se pueden asegurar solo por la garantia del Poder estatal. 
					
					Todos los hombres viven y desarrollan como un miembro del pais y la nacion. Por tanto, los derechos de los seres humanos se aseguran por unidad del pais y nacion. 
					
					Los convenios internacionales y las actividades de organizaciones internacionales relacionados con los DD.HH. tambien se realizan por las politicas y regimenes de cada pais. 
					
					Por esta razon, los reglamentos internacionales de DD.HH. definen las pautas y metas generales del aseguramiento de los derechos humanos a ser alcanzadas por cada pais bajo la condicion de respetar el Poder estatal. Esto significa que cada pais debe asegurar los derechos de las masas populares conforme a la realidad y al nivel de desarrollo de si mismo. 
					
					Pero, los imperialistas justifican la intervencion en los asuntos internos de otros paises bajo el pretexto de que "No hay fronteras en los derechos humanos.". 
					
					La epoca actual no es la de ayer en que los imperialistas modificaban a sus caprichos las fronteras de otros paises usando canones y buques militares. Por eso, los imperialistas pretenden obtener sus objetos agresivos anteponiendo el "problema de DDHH". 
					
					La divulgacion de la concepcion de valor y la "pauta de DDHH" al estilo norteamericano deviene el peligroso acto tendente a exterminar los derechos humanos en el mundo entero. 
					
					La campana de "DD.HH." de EE.UU., imperio de misantropia y de violacion de DDHH que no tiene en cuenta las masas populares, ni los Estados soberanos, ni la ley internacional, no puede evitar el fracaso por su caracter reaccionario y su villania y adelantara el fin de la unica "superpotencia". 
					
					Mientras existan en este planeta las fuerzas antipopulares, los derechos humanos de las masas populares no pueden ser logrados por las palabras o la peticion. Todas las aspiraciones de las masas populares se realizan solo por la tenaz lucha e indoblegables esfuerzos.
